pages.text: I 100% recommend using references of real-life terrain or terraforming other players have done in their own game. It can help a lot, but it's always good practicing without them as well.$(br2)Take your time! This is something I struggle with. I typically rush through everything just to get the job done or because I just want the final product, but this is

a one way ticket to a sloppy result.$(br2)You can practice basic skills in a flat world, but I wouldn't waste your time too much there and use the terrain that's already there. Flat worlds are usually better for actual builds and not terraforming.$(br2)At the end of the day, it’s your build and there are no rules on how to do certain things or how they should look.

Experiment with different mixtures of blocks and practice blending.$(br2)No matter how good you are with terraforming with WorldEdit, you’ll always have to go in and smooth certain parts with your hands.$(br2)Do not place more than 7 blocks in a straight line when rounding terrain.$(br2)Odd numbers tend to look better, excluding 2.
Foliage, foliage, foliage! For gods sake, add some flowers, ferns or leaves to the ground!
